text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so a 
couple weeks ago my mom had a recipe request and

I was so excited because she doesn't request very 
many things so she asked if I could make mango

ice cream on the show and I thought wow what 
a great idea because it's getting really hot

now in Vancouver so I could really use something 
cold while I'm filming so the recipe I am making

today is incredibly easy I mean it's the easiest 
ice cream recipe I have ever made not to mention

it's also quite healthy so you can really eat 
as much as you want without feeling too guilty

about it no special machine needed except for 
just a blender so let's get started alright

so this recipe only has four ingredients and 
maybe even three so I've got here some Greek

yogurt now Greek yogurt is basically a very thick 
yogurt where they've removed much of the way or

the watery part was very thick very luscious 
and creamy and go with full fat Greek yogurt

it really does make it a little creamier and if 
you can't find Greek yogurt where you live I'll

include a method of how you can make your own 
Greek yogurt from regular yogurt okay it's very

easy and then I've got some honey liquid sugar 
such as honey will actually help make the ice

cream softer when it freezes it won't freeze as 
hard so it'd be easier for you to scoop and also

has a wonderful flavor that goes really well with 
the mango I've also got a little bit of lime juice

now you may not need this I find that the mangoes 
that I'm getting right now in Vancouver they're

very sweet and not very tired so I do need that 
little zing that little kick to sharpen up the

flavor because you know with ice cream you want 
it to be refreshing right but if your mango is

already quite tart you may not need it at all 
speaking of mango this is the kind of mangoes

that I am using I think they're called at our faux 
mango I don't know if I said that correctly but I

prefer these two sort of the bigger rounder red 
and green ish mango it's less fibrous so that's

what you want to go with the less fibrous mango 
and make sure it is very very ripe so if it's

got a hint of green like this wait until it all 
goes away now what you want to do with these is

cut them into cubes and freeze them okay and I 
like to freeze my own mango because then I can

control exactly how good and sweet and ripe the 
mango is if you buy commercially frozen mango

you can but a lot of times they're not frozen at 
the peak of ripeness so if you're gonna use frozen

just make sure it's good quality frozen mango and 
it's sweet and right okay so for this you need a

good blender not the steak blender or a small 
you know Magic Bullet Blender you want powerful

blenders you've got a Vitamix or something like 
that that's perfect this one's okay it does its

job and you want to make sure you add the yogurt 
first if you add the mango first the blade which

is sort of spin because there's a lot of space 
so you want to add the yogurt at the bottom and

the blade won't get a stuck I'm going to add 
my honey see how my honey just slides out of

my measuring cup quite easily that is because 
I boiled my cup and now just a little squeeze

of lime juice yeah how about this much frozen 
mango and I pull it out of the freezer in the

last minute because I don't want it sitting out 
here melting and that goes you want to blend as

quickly as possible and I'm using the pulse and 
I'm going to I shouldn't use this if you have

a proper tamper that would be better but I'll 
need something to help push it through because

it's not going to go in one smooth Blizz see it's 
going to get stuck so you want to be pushing it

try not to blend your spoon if 
you're doing this with a spoon

okay stop once it starts going without getting 
stuck and it looks smooth stop you don't want

to completely melt this because because the more 
it'll melt the ice here it will become okay so now

I'm going to put it in a wide metal tray which 
I have put in the freezer so it's cold so you

want to make sure you use the metal pan so that 
it freezes as quickly as possible whenever you

make ice cream the faster it freezes the smaller 
the ice crystals and the creamier the ice cream

and quickly into the freezer okay a couple things 
as you can see it's very nice and thick and rich

and like everything that's left in here is for 
you to snack on you can actually serve it right

away and it'll have sort of like a soft-serve 
texture it's really nice so you don't have to

make this in advance however if you want something 
firmer let it freeze like that for about an hour

at one hour it'll have perfect soft scoopable 
consistency but if you have to serve it later

that's totally fine as well I find that if you let 
it sit out for about five minutes before you serve

the scooping will be easier but that's it how easy 
was that oh it's perfect see it's nicely scoopable

and yes I know this is not supposed to be used 
for ice cream but it's soft enough that I think

it'll do alright oh you can see how creamy that 
is God so refreshing so mango e and because we're

using a blender we didn't get a whole lot of air 
inside so it's got this really dense rich thick

creaminess to it oh that is so good and if you've 
got all this would be so good with that with the

Thai coconut sticky rice oh instead of mango and 
sticky rice you do mango cream and sticky rice oh

my god why didn't I think of that I should have 
brought them so I hope you get this try it is so

easy so we just mango season where you live get 
yourself some good mangos freeze them blitz it

and you're done people will be impressed so 
the recipe as always is yaha - comm send me

a photo ones you've made it on Facebook Twitter 
or Instagram and to subscribe to the show so you

can get awesome recipes like this every week and 
I'll see you next time for your next delicious
